description.narrative:
The most significant, expected project-level effect is increased trade finance for importers and exporters - as many as 1800 companies will be directly supported across 24 EMs, as well as sustained support of as many as 65 emerging market issuing banks EMIBs' capacity to provide trade finance. In terms of market creation, the enhanced capital structure of the transaction allows IFC to mobilize capital at scale via an enabling platform channel and promote integration of new investors into the trade finance asset class via the demonstration and replication channel. Specifically, the project is expected to have the following development impacts:
- Increase access to trade finance for importers and exporters in EMs - Sustain the capacity for EMIBs to provide trade finance - Economy-wide effects: GDP growth and job creation

The proposed project falls under the Global Trade Liquidity Program (GTLP), an innovative and well received trade finance program launched by the International Finance Corporation (IFC) in 2009. GTLP provides liquidity or guarantees to global or regional banks with large financial institution networks. Through GTLP, banks are able to grow their credit limits, manage risk, and support trade in Emerging Markets (EMs).
